page.title: 14Religion, Waternish
page.content: There are three churches in the area. They are the Free Church of Scotland, the Free Presbyterian Church of Scotland and the Church of Scotland, which is also known as the Established Church. The Church of Scotland was built in 1826, by Thomas Telford. The Free Church of Scotland was built in the late 1840's. The Free Presbyterian Church was built in the 1890's, by the Beaton family, who still own the land on which it is situated. The Church of Scotland was the first church to be built since Trumpan Church, which was burned down as a result of a clan feud, in 1578. All the churches in the area do not have a resident minister. All our ministers, who live in Dunvegan, also serve the parishes of Dunvegan and Glendale.
